column3: str
This unbloodied Dotharl needs help with a delivery.
Speak with the unbloodied Dotharl.
Obtain the chilled leather sack.
Deliver the chilled leather sack to Sechen.
You there. I require your help. I have to transport some provisions, but I cannot do it alone.
I await you by the river to the northwest. That is where I have left the food.
Thank you for coming. I wish to deliver all of this to an Uyagir. You are doubtless wondering why I would aid someone from another tribe.

When I was born, the Dotharl khatun looked into my eyes, and did not see a soul she recognized. When this happens, it is thought that the soul of a noble warrior from another tribe has been invited to join the Dotharl.

But this knowledge gave me no peace. I needed to know of my previous life. I set about researching the history of the other tribes. Eventually, I came across the tale of an Uyagiri warrior, one that sacrificed himself in battle to save an injured Dotharl.
It stands to reason such a benevolent spirit would become a Dotharl in their next life. I am positive this warrior's soul resides within me.
Today is his─my mother's nameday. Her name is Sechen. I decided to give her this food as a present.
However, in my excitement, I have bought far more than I could hope to carry alone. I need your help to transport the rest. My mother dwells in the Hundred–and–one Revelations.
Ah, you must be the one he said would be coming shortly.
Oh my, this is much more than I ever dared expect! Look at all this fruit. Thank you so much.
It <Emphasis>is</Emphasis> your nameday after all. You should allow yourself to be pampered on this one day at the very least.
Honestly, you do too much for me. But, know that I am grateful. Your kindness reminds me of my son so very much.
I take it he has told you everything? As an Uyagir, I am not too familiar with the concept of reincarnation. As such, I cannot judge whether or not he is truly my son.
But one thing I do know for certain is that he has been a great help to me.
You are too kind. It is a son's duty to look after his mother. I have done naught special.
Now that I think of it, I have not properly thanked you yet! I could not have delivered Mother's gifts without you. Here is a token of my gratitude.
Thank you for your aid. I have told Mother that you would be coming. Please give the gifts to her.
